CatDescriptText: James Oliver, 2191 Elmore Square, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 7, 1958, pg. 3 with question: �Do you think adults in the community are doing enough to foster constructive recreational activities, like playgrounds, centers, places to dance, Little Leagues, etc., for youth?� answer reads: �I say no. We need more playgrounds throughout the city.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of James Oliver wearing hat, moustache, striped shirt, and zippered jacket, standing in front of sign that reads "...roved... Filler", store window with small sign that reads "Keep Collar Points Down" on right, and brick and block wall on left
